TrnsysModel.author: Tim McDowell
TrnsysModel.details: A simple aquastat is modeled to output on/off control functions that can be used to control a system that heats a fluid.

variable.name: Monitoring temperature
variable.definition: The temperature of the fluid being monitored by the controller.

variable.name: Control signal for heating
variable.definition: The control signal for heating: 1: heating is required 0: heating is not required

variable.name: No. of oscillations permitted
variable.definition: The number of oscillations of the controller state allowed in one timestep before the output will be fixed and the solution found. Set to an odd number to allow the controller to bounce between two control states for successive timesteps.

variable.name: Heating setpoint
variable.definition: The temperature below which heating is commanded.

variable.name: Temperature dead band
variable.definition: The dead band temperature difference of the controller. In this model, hysteresis effects can be modeled by use of this parameter. This parameter is used to modify the heating setpoint temperature based on the state of this controller at the previous timestep. If hysteresis is not desired for this controller, simply set this parameter to 0.0
